Mere Existence of Medical Records Does Not Constitute a Claim
The mere existence of medical records does not constitute a claim.Â  There must be some intent by the claimant to apply for a benefit.
Notes
:
Claims for an increased rating were previously an exception to that rule under the historical provisions of
38 CFR 3.157(b)
.
The Standard Claims and Appeals Form regulation eliminated
38 CFR 3.157
and requires submission of claims on prescribed forms effective March 24, 2015.
